column5: on side with USB connectors.\r\n  To use J1
column6:
make sure:
   * JP4 has a jumper (it connects / disconnects 5V to HDMI pin 18).
   * JP2 (marked only as SDA/SCL - not to be confused with JP6 and JP6)
     has *two* jumpers (horizontally).
   * JP5 has a jumper (it enables the HDMI input buffer).

column5: between audio connectors and\r\n  Ethernet RJ45 connector.\r\n  To use J3
column6:
make sure:
  * JP8 has a jumper (it connects / disconnects 5V to HDMI pin 18)
  * JP6 and JP7 do *not* have any jumpers (it connect J3's and J2's
    EDID lines together).

column5: next to the power connector.\r\n  To use J2
column6:
make sure:
  * JP8 has a jumper (it connects / disconnects 5V to HDMI pin 18)
  * JP6 and JP7 do *not* have any jumpers (it connect J3's and J2's
    EDID lines together).

column5:
on the same side as switches
  + LEDs but on the underside of the board below MOD connector.
  Works as either output or input because it isn't buffered.
  Also often referred to as 'JA'.
